result.execSummary:
The defendant Tamisha D Bass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, DNA sample and surcharge by 11-07-16. Failure to pay will result in entry of civil judgment.
Concurrent with: EACH OTHER AS TO BOTH COUNTS, and Consecutive to any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tamisha D Bass

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tamisha D Bass in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Tamisha D Bass in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS TO BOTH COUNTS:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  4 months in the House of Correction, each count concurrent to each other and consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 74 days time served.  
The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges , DNA sample and surhcharge by 11-7-2016 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Tamisha D Bass not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for  final pretrial on 1-26-16 at 1:30 and jury trial in Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Tamisha D Bass not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tamisha D Bass in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Tamisha D Bass in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Havas.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Siefert, Br. 47. Case set for an adjourned pretrial conference in branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Tamisha D Bass in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Defendant Tamisha D Bass in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Discharge Summary from Justice Point.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad

Defendant Tamisha D Bass NOT in court with attorney Anne Devitt for Michale Jude. Tim Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case set for Pretrial Confernece.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held pending restitution and recompense.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MACY'S DEPARTMENT STORE, 5400 S 76TH ST., GREENDALE, WISCONSIN.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Tamisha D Bass in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Tamisha D Bass in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  All parties are advised effective August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from defendant who is incarcerated in Waukesha County Jail.  Copy forwarded to DA's office attn: Jan Kriner
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Tamisha D Bass not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.vb
